Introduction
What this project is all about.
Project goal
Main goal is to create virtual domains managing system, which will be easy to setup, maintain and integrate with other enterprise software. It should also work very reliable, fast and secure - it's designed for big sites.
Current main features
The most important thing is that thanks to modularized architecture it's easy to replace any part of a system. You can change database, or MTA part easily. Software can be configured without the need of compilation.
Main features are:
PostgreSQL support for authorization and logging
Qmail integration
CORBA based communication, which means you can use it from any language having IDL mapping
can be used easily from: C, C++, PHP, Java, Smalltalk, python
distributed hosting
all processes can run without root
written using C++, STL and boost
WWW interface for users
Planned features
This is not a closed list. If you have any suggestions please contact Pawe³ Niewiadomski.
Planned features are:
quota support
i18n support
manager of extended addresses known from Qmail
WWW interface for administrators
Postfix and Sendmail support.
remote configuration - another CORBA interface allowing to configure system
Missing features
Things that are popular but missing in v-q:
support POP3 before SMTP relaying (vpopmail does have such thing) - people use SMTP-AUTH!
support real users, authorization based on /etc/passwd
support for any other mailboxes type than Maildir
Documentation translations
Original documentation is written in English, current version can be downloaded from http://v-q.foo-baz.com.
